website_summaries.verdict: The top of the line for flower presses. If you're in a hurry or don't want to wait, this is the press that gives you same-day results.
pros: Stands out for its speed and quality
Fastest way to dry flowers with superior color retention to traditional methods
cons: Not ideal if you don’t have a microwave, although can be used without one

customer_reviews.title: Time saver with great results
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been pressing flowers with herbarium presses for year and this little gadget is honestly the coolest thing out there! Preserves the colors very well and doesn’t muddle the colors too much!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great little dryer but....
customer_reviews.text: Just received the flower press today and used it right away. DO NOT USE IT WITH DRY SHEETS! I used it twice on pansies, 30 seconds each time, the third time is was lightening storm in my microwave! Make sure you lightly spray the wool sheets with a spray bottle between dryings. I've dried about 2 dozen flowers now and they all turned out great.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great for crafting!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these ages ago, but lost it during various moves. I really love pressing flowers, and this is probably the most effective method for doing it. It does take a bit of practice to determine what cook time to use it for different types of flowers because of thickness, etc. Well worth the money once you get the hang of it!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Fun! Sturdy! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: What FUN!!!! Very sturdy construction, incredibly easy to use, practically instant results! This sure beats waiting for weeks on end for a few flowers to dry only for them to turn moldy in the meantime. This unit is as close to instant gratification as you can get, next summer is going to be a gold mine!
customer_reviews.author: S. Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this to press roses my boyfriend got me for our first Valentine's Day together. It was perfect because I travel for work and didn't have time to do the standard press method (aka. smashed in a book or wooden flower press). The roses were kind of dried out so I put a glass of water in with them for the first 30 seconds. They came out perfect! It was worth spending a little extra money to have something that is easy and quick to use. Depending on the type of flowers they can be done usually in under a minute.
customer_reviews.author: WoodwardInTheD

customer_reviews.title: Saves time on the flower pressing process
customer_reviews.text: You have to really play areound with this to figure it out, as the instructions (I feel) are not really that helpful. I like that you can speed up the time for pressing flowers. I do not think that all types of flowers can be used for this.your house will smell funny. And be sure to clean out your microwave well after as well. ( since who knows if certain flowers can give off toxic fumes, and the smell can seep into whatever you use in the microwave) If you plan on use it this a lot it’s worth it
customer_reviews.author: Inga B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Preserving Flowers
customer_reviews.text: The Microfleur 9" is a great product that saves a lot time drying flowers. The only concern I had was whether it would work in my microwave. Since the diagonal measurement of a 9" square is 12.73" and my microwave's depth was only 13 1/2", I was concerned about whether it would fit into the microwave. Fortunately, the Microfleur has rounded edges and fit well into my microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Garminlover

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended! Dries flowers in minutes!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I microwave the flowers for 30 second intervals and let them dry for a minute or so in between cook times. It is best to microwave flowers of similar size and make sure each flower is spaced a couple of inches apart.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Chan

customer_reviews.title: LOVED IT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to preserve flowers from my son's funeral. Until I watched a few YouTube videos I never knew this product existed. I've always dried them the old fashioned way of squishing them in a book and waiting and waiting and waiting. This allowed me to dry flowers in under 30 minutes. I then put them in silicone molds filled with epoxy so I have an item I can cherish forever
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I really was worried about the price. It was worth it?
customer_reviews.text: My mother in law passed recently. I wanted to keep some of her flowers. I needed to dry them fast so they didn’t loose their color. This did the trick. Well worth the money. I plan on putting them in resin to persevere them. They turned out so cute. I plan on pressing more it was to quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Collins

customer_reviews.title: So easy!  Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this press! This is my first time using a flower press of any type (other than pressing flowers between pages in a book) and this press is fantastic. I picked flowers, placed them in the press, and about 5 minutes later (heating intervals of 10 and 20 seconds, with 10-20 second rest periods in between) I have paper-like flowers ready to be set in resin!!! My pink flowers turned a deep purple, but still beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: JessRN13

customer_reviews.title: Rotten smell
customer_reviews.text: This press works well for foliage but absolutely destroys flowers. I tried a variety of flowers of different thicknesses at varied cook times and they all fried. The smell that this machine produces is rough.
customer_reviews.author: Konabearr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for professional and amateur flower pressing!
customer_reviews.text: WOW. This product was 100% worth the money. I had only flower pressed in books before and it takes days to WEEKS and your flowers often lose a lot of color. With this, though, you can go from fresh flower to fully dried in about 5 min! It’s a total game changer!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Provenzano

customer_reviews.title: Great for the hobbiest that can’t wait.
customer_reviews.text: For the hobbies who can’t wait weeks to dry flowers. Pansies came out looking spectacular but it takes practice to get the timing down.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen foss

customer_reviews.title: Easy and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This dries pressed flowers with better colorresults and much more quickly than other pressing methods. Very pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: sagemaps

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVEEEEEEE this flower press! It works amazing. I was able to press all different kinds of flowers! Even wild flowers I picked off the side of the road! What used to take me forever. Like WEEKS now takes me only seconds! Save so much time and is a great value for the money spent!! Highly recommend! Also suggest watching YouTube!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Micro Fleur Max microwave flower press. It's well-made and with simple instructions. Look forward to putting it to good use this spring/summer. Arrived in perfect condition and on time.
customer_reviews.author: SoloBlu12

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for drying small plants:flowers. Follow the instructions and it's better to give it many short blasts in the microwave rather than too long.
customer_reviews.author: PJSH

customer_reviews.title: Microfleur is the best way to press flowers
customer_reviews.text: Microfleur is the best way to press flowers. I bought this one for a gift because I have a 5" one for myself and knew it works very well. It is durable too. I have used mine for about a year. You will need to purchase some extra cloth from the fabric store, as you will only receive 2 pieces with your order.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for creating a keepsake out of your wedding flowers.
customer_reviews.text: I salvaged some of the flowers from my cousin's wedding and arranged the dry leaves and petals in a frame as a keepsake. It just takes some patience and experimentation to figure out what kinds of flowers work best. I had great success with silver dollar eucalyptus, salal, viking mums, and veronicas.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Fun, & Time Saving
customer_reviews.text: The Microfleur is quick, easy to use and creates beautiful dried flowers. Follow directions with 20-10 sec microwave intervals. I also used paper towels, but be sure there is some moisture. Practice first, but the end product should be organic just like the flowers themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: love this!
customer_reviews.text: we have had such a great time drying flowers, and putting them in resin. they come out beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Terri1216

customer_reviews.title: Try This!
customer_reviews.text: If you are using an “old time” wooden flower press as I was, you should try this. No more waiting weeks/months to see how my flowers pressed. Great results, almost instantly. A little experimentation is needed to get the time right for different flowers.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter wanted a flower press for her birthday and ...
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter wanted a flower press for her birthday and so i bought this one. Spendy and I should have bought the smaller one - that i didn't see until after the button was pushed, but she loves it and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen anderson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Takes some trial and error on hearing times, but once figured out - quick with great results
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easily presses flowers and foliage!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE using this flower press. The instructions are clear and the press is incredibly easy to use. I use a regular microwave and it works just fine
customer_reviews.author: RLB

customer_reviews.title: Well made product and great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous customer service, should you ever need it. The product seems well made and sturdy and easy to use. I look forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: FIRE HAZARD
customer_reviews.text: Loved it till I started to smell smoke. I put it in the microwave for 30 seconds then 20
customer_reviews.author: cmg

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today and was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Joy Adams

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely skeptical of drying flowers and plants in the microwave but this thing is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Anna J

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love my microwave flower press! Sometimes it takes longer if you have more bulky flowers to get them dry but all of mine have come out beautifully. Keeps color better than normal pressing
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for quick flower pressing
customer_reviews.text: I'm using my new flower press to press flowers from my daughter's wedding bouquet. This does the job beautifully and quickly! Instructions on how to use this are clear and my flowers are pressed and dry according the time estimates in the instructions. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: LindyLouTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: This is out of the box crafting at it's best! In minutes you have the understanding you need to start drying flower petals and leaves. My first batch of leaves I burnt. But after that I was more cautious and had wonderful results with vivid colors!
customer_reviews.author: K. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea just needs fine tuning
customer_reviews.text: Burns very easily! Turns out well if you use 10 seconds at a time but any more and the wool burns
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany F

customer_reviews.title: Practice makes perfect
customer_reviews.text: Lots of trial & error depending on the specimens you’re using, but once your past the learning curve it’s smooth sailing despite being a little tedious.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job drying flowers...so I am told.
customer_reviews.text: Present for the misses. She has used it several times this summer and really likes it. Was using a book press system before, this is much quicker and she says it gives better results. I agree with her. Not because I think it is better, I have no clue, but because that's what you are supposed to do, so I say "Yep looks great" or something to that extent. She is excited and likes it, so what else really matters?
customer_reviews.author: EMK

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I l-o-v-e my flower press. Would be neat if it had multiple levels.
customer_reviews.author: L. Machine

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Some flowers do have a weird smell. Other than that no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this flower press
customer_reviews.text: I love this flower press. If you are a flower enthusiast like myself, you will thoroughly enjoy this particular press.
customer_reviews.author: Lisamichelle H.

customer_reviews.title: Love this flower press
customer_reviews.text: Simple, quick & easy to use. Very small learning curve, learned how to do it "right" very quickly. There is only a learning curve because every microwave is different. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest, fastest, most effective way to press flowers. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: ACHA

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to preserve flowers from my mothers funeral. It was so easy to use and did a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I really like the convenience of pressing flowers and getting a quick ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the convenience of pressing flowers and getting a quick result. I am using this to press plants for my horticulture course
customer_reviews.author: Raewyn macKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Can't stop using this Press!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this press and a re-fill and it's great! Be patient, don't over dry, use a small amount of time until you find the perfect recipe for each unique leaf, petal and flower. The possibilities are endless!
customer_reviews.author: ImaAmazonaholic!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I love using pressed flowers in my art, and this makes it easy to take right from the garden without having wait 3-4 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Roobob

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Use it daily, actually have 2 so I don't wear out one. Great product. Would purchase from seller again. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use . Self explanatory. Addicting
customer_reviews.text: I love using this. Saves so much time over using gel to dry flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Erin L.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it claims to do! Easy to use and perfect if you need to dry and press flowers in a pinch. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing product! We were surprised by how quickly this product works.
customer_reviews.author: Aokanne

customer_reviews.title: Microwave Flowers etc. and have them ready to use in less than 2 hours!!!
customer_reviews.text: A botanist friend gifted me a professional botanical press which I find tedious and time consuming, with wing nuts to be tightened and time to wait...and wait...this Microfleur is just crazy! It works perfectly and I quickly learned to do the first couple of "nukings" (with rest time in between - usually I just forgot it was in the microwave!) and then CHECK. Checking frequently avoids 'browning' carefully chosen flowers etc. This thing works exactly as advertised and I'm glad I bought it, in fact I'm going to buy two more, so I can do a lot of drying at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: CONSUMER

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, I was pressing flowers in minutes instead of weeks. It does smell quite a but when you take the flowers out of the microwave, but it's a fantastic project otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Richard faust

customer_reviews.title: Works with a little practice.
customer_reviews.text: It does work but it's tricky getting the timing right. Sometimes it just melts the petals. I'll keep practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Kinden

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: love this press. it takes some experimentation but definitely worth it! i'm excited to try many more flowers once Spring arrives.
customer_reviews.author: the brue

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: just start with fifteen second at a time, depends on your microwave, wonderful product
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Glass

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It worked so well that I just ordered a second one. Thank you for the quick response.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well but for the price I couldn't justify keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Karpf

customer_reviews.title: Works great, experiment first!
customer_reviews.text: Fast and so easy. My pics are from my first try, and you can see I wasn't perfect, but it was so much better than waiting weeks to dress a flower. The directions are great (and warn you against doing different types of flowers at once like I did) and include a bunch of tips. Not sure if it's worth the money yet but I'm optimistic!
customer_reviews.author: SKAster 22

customer_reviews.title: I would give 10 out of 5 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this Microfleur!! I now have 3 of them because I can find so many things to use in them and patience is not one of my greater virtues!!! That is my honest and experienced opinion, and while I have not EVER received anything as a free or promo item (hint, hint, and how do you sign up for THAT program!), I can only give 5 stars and Kudos regardless!! (and I did buy spare parts separately from the mfgr. Customer service is wonderful too!!) :-)
customer_reviews.author: The Squire

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: This is the bomb! Whoever made this is genius. I’ve never dried flowers before. This is so easy. I didn’t think it would dry roses since roses are kinda thick. I have a strong microwave. I put 2 or 3 roses in the plate... first burst I did 40 secs... all the other is 30 secs till I feel it’s dried enough. Oh and I wiped the moisture off the plate after every burst. Can’t wait to put it in resin. BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa V

customer_reviews.title: Home schooling? What a great project to do!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first craft project and I didn’t know any that I literally could take out of the box and use perfectly and easily. The flowers in the colors this season were so vibrant and beautiful I was looking for the best way to preserve the color and I found this. I watched a video on YouTube and the woman use this press it looks easy and when this press arrive it was So simple and the flowers came out so beautiful. One thing I really enjoyed about those is that you can move the flowers during the drying process and that makes him even prettier I can’t wait to start using these flowers and other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Best press I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike screw down style, every square inch of the pressing plate is usable. Clips slip on and off in seconds! Even arthritic hands and children are able to operate. 60 seconds is sufficient for most flowers and leaves. Moisture from dehydration evaporates off within minutes allowing just enough time to refill for the next batch. Note that all the pieces should be separated when hot and moist to facilitate drying otherwise the pieces get too wet and therefore too hot. All pieces must be dry before use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Beautiful Way to Press Flowers!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been pressing flowers for over 50 years now and this is the greatest invention ever for this craft – if used correctly, the flowers dry so much faster, & therefore the color stays so much more intense! My daughter found the 5” one at a yard sale & got me hooked on it, so I really wanted the larger size, but just couldn’t bring myself to pay that much money. I finally broke down and got it, and I am very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: eurekalily

customer_reviews.title: Microfleur 9" flower press
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Our granddaughter had to collect and dry 25 wild flowers for a school project. We could not have asked for a better product. It took just a little time figuring out how much time to leave in the microwave after the initial 30 seconds; however, once we did, the drying of the flowers was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Works, but stinks up the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for pressing flowers. Follow the advice of the top review and your flowers should come out well. Be warned though, that beautiful smelling flowers tend to stink up the kitchen after being nuked in the microwave. Roses smell nothing like they normally do when they are dried out in the microwave and made my kitchen stink. Have some air freshener available anytime you use this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: The lighter colored flowers (white or pale) will not come out as pretty as the deeper color ones
customer_reviews.text: It's quite expensive for what you get, but it does its job well. The lighter colored flowers (white or pale) will not come out as pretty as the deeper color ones. It does a particularly great job drying leaves/twigs/ vines.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy and quick it was to dry my flowers. Great for resin and card making.
customer_reviews.author: Qyenniebaby

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well; easy to use; creates beautiful full-colored dried flowers. Bought this for a gift and my daughter LOVES it. Memorialized flowers from her grandfather's funeral that she gifted to the family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... watch the youtube video first the Microfleur does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: If you watch the youtube video first the Microfleur does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: bookie

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: Drying flowers from my garden. I will like to have an extra pair of the cloth with the set. It got really fast 😎. And maybe not being so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick drying flowers
customer_reviews.text: Appoint with other reviews, this is a good product that takes a bit of practice to perfect. Definitely worth it if you dry flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Revolutionized my craft !
customer_reviews.text: This press in the microwave dries flowers in 30-1.30 seconds! That save me 3 or more weeks for every flower pressed. THANK YOU MICRO FLEUR AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Ruddick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The Microfleur is easy to use. The instructions are easy to read. I wanted the smaller model but it was sold out. I am actually glad I have the larger one so I can dry longer flowers and stems.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Trenholm

customer_reviews.title: Worked fairly well to preserve my Granddaughters funeral arrangement for use in a shadow box.
customer_reviews.text: Liked how it worked so easy to dry flowers in the microwave. Takes several times to dry out a thick flower like a rose.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri  L  Camp

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: So glad it’s stupid proof! I hate buying a tool and it being complicated! I bought it based on Pam at the paper outpost on YouTube and am glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: JONI L ALLEN

customer_reviews.title: Best product
customer_reviews.text: Works great to save all leaves. Given as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: theresa l. XXXXXXXX

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This does the best job preserving the color. Reds definitely don’t look as good dried but purples and yellows do really well!
customer_reviews.author: Raina Osmundson

customer_reviews.title: 💕💕💕
customer_reviews.text: I just love it 😍 it light and very easy to use, and the results it brilliant 👌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Heba mu

customer_reviews.title: A Home Run for Those Interested in Pressing Flowers The Modern Way!
customer_reviews.text: A very nice advance in pressing flowers. The process is simple and the results pleasing to the eye. Can't deny how nice it is to have the flowers and leaves, etc. ready very fast compared to the 6-8 week book pressing technique. Would buy it again in a heartbeat ~ worth every penny. High quality in every way!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Must have pacience to work with this method.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, however- it’s a pretty intensive method. You have to Microwave in very slow Increments. Best for someone with pacience.
customer_reviews.author: non-consumer

customer_reviews.title: worth the price
customer_reviews.text: ok so i zap my flowers for 45 seconds then let them dry few days in press. That just works better for me..
customer_reviews.author: Babylass

customer_reviews.title: Item received in good condition
customer_reviews.text: Received in good condition and looked like it was pictured. Haven’t got to try it yet. Price seemed high for what it is though.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: Great for first timer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a first time flower presser. Worked well for my wedding flowers!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend this
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for small flowers. I love how quickly I can have a perfectly dried flower and be able to use it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.RedBeard

customer_reviews.title: Really hard to figure out how long to microwave
customer_reviews.text: The directions aren't very good. Lots of trial and error.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An amazing product. I had never tried flower pressing in ...
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product. I had never tried flower pressing in the microwave but found it easy to use. A little expensive but a fun product. Does creat a little smell while drying. Opening a window takes care of it. Looking forward to trying more plants.
customer_reviews.author: Shanancy

customer_reviews.title: Microwave flowers for pressing
customer_reviews.text: Had a couple before. Great alternative to pressing between book pages
customer_reviews.author: Constance S. Mussey

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Makes for fast pressed flowers We like the larger size. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great at drying flowers and leaves!
customer_reviews.text: works great and fast! get to save some of my garden flowers forever...use it for making cards or decoupage gourd birdhouses.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Sue

customer_reviews.title: Press Flowers in Minutes
customer_reviews.text: This device is both easy and efficient. I use it to press plants, including whole roses, carnations, and sunflowers, for framed arrangements with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great product needs more information about how to use it
customer_reviews.text: Does an exceptional good job. It would be helpful if more information was included telling one how to better use it. Example; large fresh open rose can be placed face down on the pads and placed in the micro without the top which allows the flower to soften enough to then add the top piece and start the pressing without smashing the flower. I had to find this out by trial and error at the expense of some very nice roses.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ireland

customer_reviews.title: I love not having to wait weeks for my pressed flowers
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well. I love not having to wait weeks for my pressed flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Wingbeats551

customer_reviews.title: flower press
customer_reviews.text: makes pressing flowers so much easier. easy to use. love this product. great for any craft person who works with flowers.
customer_reviews.author: hospice rn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfection! Rarely do I buy a to that actually exceeds my expectations in every way— this is one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly fast and retains colors beautifully. I've recommended it to our garden club.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Eaton

customer_reviews.title: It looks like it will be great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift. It looks like it will be great!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Idea/Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact to travel with. Bought this for my destination wedding so I can press my bouquet. I have tried this on a few flowers and it is so much faster. It does take some patience. I recommend microwaving it in intervals like the box says but then letting them sit out for a bit (like a few days) to let them dry a little more naturally so they don't burn. Fits good in my small microwave. Love this item.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use and leaves the microwaved plants in great ...
customer_reviews.text: The product was what I was looking for, but is over priced. It is easy to use and leaves the microwaved plants in great shape and color. The only real criticism is on the four side clamps that holds the press together. The material is a little flimsy and the quality is not up to par with the rest of the press. After a few times using the press, the clamps do not hold as tight as I would like and I'm afraid after using it awhile they will become more loose.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde A. VanCise

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This has been used for leaves only so far, and worked well. Do be careful and paitent, as things can "cook" if you microwave them for too long. The felt pads benefit from a little airing out between bursts in the microwave so the moisture can evaporate, as they do get a bit damp. Wiping down the plastic press after each use helps, as it too had some beads of moisture. Great product and time saver if you are pressing a lot of material.
customer_reviews.author: andrea

product_meta.title: Microfleur 9" (23 cm) Max Microwave Flower Press
feature_bullets: BETTER COLOUR RETENTION compared to traditional methods of flower pressing. No more waiting weeks to find that your flowers have turned brown and the plants are done blooming so you have to wait until next year to try those flowers again.

MULTIPLE USES: Commonly used by oshibana and other artists, jewelry makers, journaling & scrapbooking, gardeners, resin crafts, as well as by botanists. Pressed flowers can be used for greeting cards, scrapbooking, wedding and other invitations, menus, bookmarks or applied to candles and soap, art and decoupage projects. Press flowers, leave, and even dry herbs.

FAST & EASY to press & dry flowers, fitting in any conventional microwave. Press flowers in minutes! (Minutes: broken up in a few or many short bursts in the microwave. Please follow the instructions carefully.) Plants, flowers and leaves can be used the same day or stored for later.
PATENTED DESIGN releases moisture from flowers, leaves, plant material, botanicals, herbs, allowing them to press and dry quickly.
REUSABLE: Made in the USA from durable material and is 100% reusable for hundreds of pressings with proper use and care. Liners are washable. No papers or layers to replace each time.
